author: filzek
body:
Hi,

Powershell is a awesome tool but it lacks from a simples COLOR disable output, as if we try to caputre it outputs its always colored and destroy any work possible for a RAW output from any kind of console application.

It is a must to have an option at the console to just running a command as powershell -disabllecoloredoutput -c command

That is so simple, thousand of people asking for it around the internet, and still not being answered by the devs, WHY?

comments.author: jborean93
comments.body: There's a new feature added for 7.2 that will give you a way to control this using env vars https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/14964.

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body: One partial fix is to Remove the PSReadline Module.

title: Powershell disable horrible colored lines when we need a standard CLEAR output
